a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: How does extreme monetary poverty compare to multidimensional
Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards indicators. Extreme
poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024); Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2024) - The Global
Note: Extreme poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income
measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita. Multidimensional poverty is based on the most recent household
